result.execSummary:
The defendant Cordell M. Howze was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs to be paid 1 year after release from prison. Alternate 5 days jail.
DNA already paid and taken on another case.
Concurrent with: the prison time currently serving

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Cordell M. Howze in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, enhancer struck.  Court finds defendant guilty.  State makes recomendtions.  Attorney Weathers makes statements.  Cordell Howze makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following:
Count 1, enhancer struck. 

Imposed Sentence of:
9 months jail, concurrent to his time in prison. 
Costs: $278.00 To be paid 1 year after release from prison, or serve 5 days in jail.  

DNA has already been paid and taken on another case.   
Felony warnings, immigration warnings,  voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Enhancer Struck.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defense requests matter be set for plea and sentencing and the defendant be produced for the next hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
